Question: Murray disposed of the remaining copies in 1820, and this person's novels remained out of print for twelve years.
Hints: The manuscript remained in Crosby's hands, unpublished, until this person repurchased the copyright from him in 1816.
This person began work on a second novel, First Impressions, in 1796.
When **** was twenty, Tom Lefroy, a nephew of neighbours, visited Steventon from December 1795 to January 1796.
